intro: Pogonostylis squarrosus, commonly known as the squarrose pogonostylis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, often clustered in loose inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in lowland forests or on rocky slopes.
